title: User​
content: This item is read only and cannot be modified. Read Only </> Member.User: User The user that the member object represents.

title: Group​
content: This item is read only and cannot be modified. Read Only </> Member.Group: Group The group that the user is in.

title: Client​
content: This item is read only and cannot be modified. Read Only </> Member.Client: Client A reference back to the client that owns this object.

title: Role​
content: This item is read only and cannot be modified. Read Only </> Member.Role: Role The role the user has in the group.

title: __call ​
content: </> Member.__call ( _: Member, Client: Client,-- The client to make requests with. GroupId: Group | number,-- The Group or GroupId the member belongs to. UserId: User | number,-- The User or UserId the member object represents. Data: {[any]=any}-- Optional preset data. Used within the library, not meant for general use. ) → Member Constructs a member object.

title: GetRole ​
content: </> Member:GetRole () → Role? Gets the role of the member in the group.

title: SetRole ​
content: </> Member:SetRole ( Role: Role | number-- The Role or RoleId to set the user to. ) → boolean Sets the role of the member in the group.

title: Exile ​
content: </> Member:Exile () → boolean Exiles the member from the group.

title: Id​
content: This item is read only and cannot be modified. Read Only </> User.Id: number The UserId of the user.

title: Client​
content: This item is read only and cannot be modified. Read Only </> User.Client: Client A reference back to the client that owns this object.

title: Name​
content: This item is read only and cannot be modified. Read Only </> User.Name: string The Username of the user.

title: Description​
content: This item is read only and cannot be modified. Read Only </> User.Description: string The description (about me) of the user.

title: Created​
content: This item is read only and cannot be modified. Read Only </> User.Created: number The creation date/time (unix time) of the user.

title: IsBanned​
content: This item is read only and cannot be modified. Read Only </> User.IsBanned: boolean If the user is banned or not.

title: DisplayName​
content: This item is read only and cannot be modified. Read Only </> User.DisplayName: string The display name of the user.

title: Friends​
content: This item is read only and cannot be modified. Read Only </> User.Friends: {User} A list of users the user is friended to.

title: __call ​
content: </> User.__call ( _: User, Client: Client,-- The client to make requests with. UserId: number | string,-- The Username or UserId. Data: {[any]=any}-- Optional preset data. Used within the library, not meant for general use. ) → User Constructs a user object.

title: GetData ​
content: </> User:GetData () → { Name:string, Description:string, Created:number, IsBanned:boolean, DisplayName:string } Gets data about the user.

title: GetFriends ​
content: </> User:GetFriends () → {User} Gets the users friends.

title: GetFriendCount ​
content: </> User:GetFriendCount () → number Gets the number of friends the user has.

content: This item is read only and cannot be modified. Read Only </> Role.Client: Client A reference back to the client that owns this object.

content: This item is read only and cannot be modified. Read Only </> Role.Name: string The name of the role.

title: Description​
content: This item is read only and cannot be modified. Read Only </> Role.Description: string The description of the role.

title: Rank​
content: This item is read only and cannot be modified. Read Only </> Role.Rank: number The rank of the role, a number between 0 and 255.

title: MemberCount​
content: This item is read only and cannot be modified. Read Only </> Role.MemberCount: number The number of members that are this role.

title: Group​
content: This item is read only and cannot be modified. Read Only </> Role.Group: Group The group that this role is a part of.

title: Members​
content: This item is read only and cannot be modified. Read Only </> Role.Members: PageCursor A PageCursor object that retrieves the members in the role.

title: __call ​
content: </> Role.__call ( _: Role, Client: Client,-- The client to make requests with. RoleId: number | string,-- The RoleId of the role. Data: {[any]=any}-- Optional preset data. Used within the library, not meant for general use. ) → Role Constructs a user object.

title: GetData ​
content: </> Role:GetData () → { Name:string, Description:string, Rank:number, MemberCount:number } Gets data about the role.

title: GetMembers ​
content: </> Role:GetMembers () → PageCursor Gets a PageCursor object with every member that has this role.

content: This item is read only and cannot be modified. Read Only </> Group.ShoutUpdated: number? When the shout was updated (unix time).

content: </> Group.__call ( _: Group, Client: Client,-- The client to make requests with. GroupId: number,-- The GroupId of the group. Data: {[any]=any}-- Optional preset data. Used within the library, not meant for general use. ) → Group Constructs a group object.

title: GetData ​
content: </> Group:GetData () → { Name:string, Description:string, MemberCount:number, PublicEntryAllowed:boolean, Owner:User?, ShoutBody:string?, ShoutCreated:number?, ShoutUpdated:number?, ShoutPoster:User? } Gets data about the group.

title: Cookie​
content: This item is read only and cannot be modified. Read Only </> Client.Cookie: string The cookie of the authenticated user to be used in requests.

title: Token​
content: This item is read only and cannot be modified. Read Only </> Client.Token: string The X-CSRF-TOKEN to be used in requests.

title: __call ​
content: </> Client.__call () → Client Constructs a client object.

title: Group ​
content: </> Client:Group ( GroupId: number,-- The GroupId of the group. Data: {[any]=any}-- Optional preset data. Used within the library, not meant for general use. ) → Group Constructs a Group object.

content: </> Client:Role ( RoleId: number,-- The RoleId of the role. Data: {[any]=any}-- Optional preset data. Used within the library, not meant for general use. ) → Role Constructs a Role object.

title: Member ​
content: </> Client:Member ( GroupId: number | Group,-- The group that the member object is a member of. UserId: number | User,-- The user that the member is for. Data: {[any]=any}-- Optional preset data. Used within the library, not meant for general use. ) → Member Constructs a Member object.

title: User ​
content: </> Client:User ( UserId: number | string,-- The UserId or Username of the user. Data: {[any]=any}-- Optional preset data. Used within the library, not meant for general use. ) → Role Constructs a User object.

title: PageCursor ​
content: </> Client:PageCursor ( Endpoint: string,-- The endpoint to get pages from. Tags: {[string]=any},-- Optional list of tags to add on to the request. Interpret: function,-- The function that interprets recieved data, to turn it into a useable format. SortOrder: string?,-- The sort order to use when requesting for pages. Can be "Asc" or "Desc". Limit: number?,-- The page item limit to use when requesting pages. PageDataLocation: string?,-- The location where page data is located for non-standard pages. PageNextLocation: string?,-- The location where the next page cursor is found for non-standard pages. PagePreviousLocation: string?,-- The location where the previous page cursor is found for non-standard pages. CursorTag: string?,-- The name of the tag to send the cursor for non-standard pages. LimitTag: string?,-- The name of the tag to send the limit for non-standard pages. SortOrderTag: string?-- The name of the tag to send the sort order for non-standard pages. ) → PageCursor Constructs a PageCursor object. This is used within the library, but it can be used yourself.

title: Authenticate ​
content: </> Client:Authenticate ( Cookie: string-- The cookie to authenticate the client with. ) → () Authenticates the client, once authenticated the client cannot be deauthenticated.

title: Request ​
content: </> Client:Request ( Method: string,-- The HTTP method to use. Endpoint: string,-- The target URL. Tags: {[string]=any},-- Optional tags (querystrings) to add to the request. Headers: {[string]=any},-- Optional headers to add to the request. Body: {[any]=any}-- Optional body to send with the request. ) → ( boolean,-- If the request was successful (code 200) {[number | string]=any},-- The body of the response. {[string]=any}-- The headers of the response. ) Makes a HTTP request with the client's Cookie and X-CSRF-TOKEN.

title: Client​
content: This item is read only and cannot be modified. Read Only </> PageCursor.Client: Client A reference back to the client that owns this object.

title: Endpoint​
content: This item is read only and cannot be modified. Read Only </> PageCursor.Endpoint: string The URL to send requests to.

title: Tags​
content: This item is read only and cannot be modified. Read Only </> PageCursor.Tags: {[string]=any} The URL to send requests to.

title: Interpret​
content: This item is read only and cannot be modified. Read Only </> PageCursor.Interpret: function The function that parses return data to turn it into a usable form.

title: SortOrder​
content: This item is read only and cannot be modified. Read Only </> PageCursor.SortOrder: "Asc" | "Desc" The sort order sent with the request.

title: Limit​
content: This item is read only and cannot be modified. Read Only </> PageCursor.Limit: number The number of items that should be sent with each page.

title: PageDataLocation​
content: This item is read only and cannot be modified. Read Only </> PageCursor.PageDataLocation: string The location where data is found for non-standard pages.

title: PageNextLocation​
content: This item is read only and cannot be modified. Read Only </> PageCursor.PageNextLocation: string The location where the next page cursor is found for non-standard pages.

title: PageNextLocation​
content: This item is read only and cannot be modified. Read Only </> PageCursor.PageNextLocation: string The location where the next page cursor is found for non-standard pages.

title: PagePreviousLocation​
content: This item is read only and cannot be modified. Read Only </> PageCursor.PagePreviousLocation: string The location where the previous page cursor is found for non-standard pages.

title: CursorTag​
content: This item is read only and cannot be modified. Read Only </> PageCursor.CursorTag: string The querystring name of the cursor for non-standard pages.

title: LimitTag​
content: This item is read only and cannot be modified. Read Only </> PageCursor.LimitTag: string The querystring name of the limit for non-standard pages.

title: SortOrderTag​
content: This item is read only and cannot be modified. Read Only </> PageCursor.SortOrderTag: string The querystring name of the sort order for non-standard pages.

title: LastPage​
content: This item is read only and cannot be modified. Read Only </> PageCursor.LastPage: boolean If the page you are currently on is the last page.

title: FirstPage​
content: This item is read only and cannot be modified. Read Only </> PageCursor.FirstPage: boolean If the page you are currently on is the first page.

title: NextCursor​
content: This item is read only and cannot be modified. Read Only </> PageCursor.NextCursor: string? The cursor for the next page.

title: PreviousCursor​
content: This item is read only and cannot be modified. Read Only </> PageCursor.PreviousCursor: string? The cursor for the previous page.

title: __call ​
content: </> PageCursor.__call ( _: PageCursor, Client: Client,-- The client to make requests with. Endpoint: string,-- The endpoint to get pages from. Tags: {[string]=any},-- Optional list of tags to add on to the request. Interpret: function,-- The function that interprets recieved data, to turn it into a useable format. SortOrder: string?,-- The sort order to use when requesting for pages. Can be "Asc" or "Desc". Limit: number?,-- The page item limit to use when requesting pages. PageDataLocation: string?,-- The location where page data is located for non-standard pages. PageNextLocation: string?,-- The location where the next page cursor is found for non-standard pages. PagePreviousLocation: string?,-- The location where the previous page cursor is found for non-standard pages. CursorTag: string?,-- The name of the tag to send the cursor for non-standard pages. LimitTag: string?,-- The name of the tag to send the limit for non-standard pages. SortOrderTag: string?-- The name of the tag to send the sort order for non-standard pages. ) → PageCursor Constructs a PageCursor object.

title: Next ​
content: </> PageCursor:Next () → {<T>} This gets the next page and returns it.

title: Previous ​
content: </> PageCursor:Previous () → {<T>} This gets the previous page and returns it.
